intro: Erythrostemon yucatanensis var. chiapensis, commonly known as the Chiapan erythrostemon, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central America. It belongs to the Sterculiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically range in color from red to orange. The plant features woody stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. This variant is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its vibrant floral display.
